etymology.description: 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") + 尞(尞) (liáo, phonetic) = sound association with substance related to rice -> material or ingredient
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") representing an essential staple or material, with the phonetic 尞(尞) (liáo), conveying the idea of a basic component or ingredient in a broader sense.

examples.chinese: 麦子是制作面包的重要原料(麥子是製作麵包的重要原料)。
examples.pinyin: Mài zǐ shì zhìzuò miànbāo de zhòngyào yuánliào.
examples.english: Wheat is an important raw material for making bread.

examples.chinese: 他料得到比赛会很激烈(他料得到比賽會很激烈)，所以建议好好准备(所以建議好好準備)。
examples.pinyin: Tā liào dédào bǐsài huì hěn jīliè, suǒyǐ jiànyì hǎohǎo zhǔnbèi.
examples.english: He estimates that the match will be intense, so he suggests preparing well.

examples.chinese: 这道菜的主要调料是花椒和八角(這道菜的主要調料是花椒和八角)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài de zhǔyào tiáoliào shì huājiāo hé bājiǎo.
examples.english: The main seasoning for this dish is Sichuan pepper and star anise.
